Walk: If all cars stopped working, walking would be the only viable option to travel from one city to another. This would require a lot of physical effort and time, but it is a safe and healthy way to travel.

Bicycle: Another option would be to use a bicycle. This would require some effort to acquire a bicycle and learn how to ride, but it would be a more efficient and environmentally friendly way to travel.

Public Transportation: If public transportation systems such as buses, trains, and subways were still operational, it would be a good option to travel from one city to another. This would require some planning and research to find out which public transportation systems are still available.

Ride-Sharing Services: If ride-sharing services such as Uber and Lyft were still available, it would be possible to use them to travel from one city to another. This would require some research to find out which ride-sharing services are still operational.

Hitchhiking: Another option would be to hitchhike. This would require some effort to acquire a ride, but it would be a more efficient and cost-effective way to travel. It is important to note that hitchhiking can be dangerous and should only be done in safe areas.
